text: __NOTOC__ Friedrich-Carl Cranz (14 November 1886 – 24 March 1941) was a German general during World War II who commanded 18th Infantry Division. He was a recipient of the Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross. Cranz was killed 24 March 1941 in a training accident by friendly artillery fire. He is buried in the Invalid's Cemetery in Berlin. ==Awards and decorations== * Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross on 29 June 1940 as Generalleutnant and commander of 18. Infanterie-Division Fellgiebel 2000, p. 132. ==References== ===Citations=== ===Bibliography=== * Category:1886 births Category:1941 deaths Category:People from Chełmno Category:People from West Prussia Category:Lieutenant generals of the German Army (Wehrmacht) Category:German military personnel killed in World War II Category:Recipients of the clasp to the Iron Cross, 1st class Category:Recipients of the Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross Category:Military personnel killed by friendly fire Category:Burials at the Invalids' Cemetery
title: Friedrich-Carl Cranz
